description: In the 17th and 18th centuries, the Age of Reason and Enlightenment sparked revolutions throughout
Europe and the world. This course explores how the Nordic nations were shaped by this
transformative era. Students analyze the impact of these global movements on Nordic history,
examining new views on science, religion, and government. Students learn how these countries were
an interconnected part of a revolutionary time, experiencing their own significant shifts in
power, society, and culture. Offered periodically in spring semester.
